content.text:
# Marianne Ihalainen Award

| nickname    =
| sponsor     =
| location    =
| country     = Finland
| presenter   = Finnish Ice Hockey Association
| first       = 1983
| number      = 42
| last        =
| firstwinner = Anne Haanpää, 1983
| mostwins    = Karoliina Rantamäki (6)
| mostrecent  = Emma Nuutinen, 2025
| url         =
}}
The Marianne Ihalainen Award () an ice hockey trophy seasonally awarded by the Finnish Ice Hockey Association to the regular season top point scorer of the Auroraliiga, known as the Naisten Liiga during 2017 to 2024, and as the Naisten SM-sarja during 1982 to 2017. It is named after Marianne Ihalainen, former SM-sarja forward and one of the most accomplished women in the history of Finnish ice hockey.
